file_content.text: Shalim, come in. The Regulators' weapon caches are all destroyed.
Outstanding! I hope you're ready for more--we've detected an army of war droids massing for an attack.
Hutt engineers just installed a light bridge to access the ark construction site. The path leads directly through my plantation.
If those war droids make it across that bridge, they'll slaughter everyone in their path--including us.
If the Hutts can set up a light bridge, we can take it down.
Then we'll disable the bridge.
I had something slightly more destructive in mind.
You said the war droids are already in place. Why haven't they moved in?
Why haven't they attacked?
We think they're awaiting orders from the Regulator Command center. We're still hunting for that.
Giant portable platforms for moving huge numbers? I can't think of anyone who might need something like that.
Light bridges sound useful.
We were planning to set up light bridges to evacuate our citizens to the ark. The Hutts beat us to the idea.
The war droids are holding position for now, but you could lure them out by transmitting false orders from the mercenary army's comm towers.
Once the droids are halfway across the light bridge, you could deactivate it. Drop the whole army into the depths.
Those droids will spend the rest of this fight seven kilometers down.
Good plan.
At the rate the planet's collapsing, they won't have time to rust.
What a waste of perfectly good droids. Is there any way to reprogram them to fight for us?
Can't we just reprogram them?
The master control is out of our reach. There simply isn't time.
Droids make hilarious noises when they're destroyed. Too bad we won't be able to hear them.
I'm going to enjoy this.
Slice into the mercenary comm towers, transmit the false marching orders and deactivate the light bridge at the perfect moment. Good luck!
